text: red wine braised short ribs they are
everybody's favorite thing to make
either on a Sunday or for a dinner party
they make your house smell amazing they
take about 20 minutes to throw together
and they're super simple so let's make
them okay
so you can't make red wine braised short
ribs without your short ribs so when
going to the butcher you're gonna want
to ask for English style short ribs cut
about two inches thick
before I sear them I'm going to season
them really well and buy really well I
mean like pretty generously I like to
lay them all out because that way I can
see all the surface area now that my
short ribs are generously season I'm
going to sear that so I've got a really
nice cast-iron Dutch oven this is where
you're developing a lot of the flavor
you're getting a really nice
golden-brown crust
don't skimp on this step because the
rest of it is pretty hands off the pan
is very hot I'm going to add a little
bit of oil to get them going it doesn't
really matter what side you start on so
whatever tickles your fancy you've heard
the phrase don't crowd the pan before
and here's why it's important remember
that golden brown crust we were talking
about moments ago well you won't be able
to get that if there's too many shorts
and pants he'll end up steaming together
and get that sort of grayish color that
nobody's interested in so I've got half
of my short ribs in the pan now and I'll
do the other half on these come out and
it'll all get done it'll be great so my
second batch is all brown they're
looking really amazing these short ribs
it obviously shrunk a little bit and
some of that is coming from the fact
that they've lost during searing short
ribs are already so fatty on their own
that we don't need the additional fat
that's left over so we're just gonna
drain it you'll have some really nice
brown bits on the bottom of your pan and
no need to wipe those out so all that
fat that we just removed we are going to
sort of put back because in that fat is
flavor and we're going to
at pancetta we like pancetta because it
is porky and salty and delicious without
being smoky which can sort of overwhelm
the other flavors I'm gonna cook this
pancetta and until the fat starts to
render and you'll see that start to
happen it'll shrink the bits will become
a little bit golden brown maybe crispy
I'm gonna add my onions and my time the
nice thing about a dish like this is
that it also doesn't really matter how
good your knife skills are because
everything gets strained out at the end
anyway so my onions have been going for
a while they're mingling with the
pancetta they're looking really nice now
I'm gonna add my carrots you may be
asking yourself what is a young carrot
well we mean any sort of tiny cute
little carrot they're gonna cook faster
and you don't need to cut them but if
you can only find large carrots just
make sure you cut them roughly this size
I'm gonna add the tomatoes and these are
chopped canned tomatoes we love canned
tomatoes now we are gonna add my
favorite ingredient which is wine and I
know you've heard before if you wouldn't
drink it cook with it so I always for
myself just a really small amount I'm
gonna add the short ribs back to the pot
and I like to do this with tongs because
I can sort of nestle them in there and
make sure that they all fit it's like a
big party in there you know there's room
for everybody when it comes time to like
the last couple that you're gonna put in
the pot you'll notice that it's getting
a little tight I always put them bone
side up so then you'll know that at
least your meats gonna get tender and
grace there's any juices left over in
your bowl from the short ribs just throw
that into and I'm gonna put the lid on
it
you want this at a steady simmer
three-and-a-half to four hours and
they'll be good to go we're gonna make
our gremolata now and this one it can be
sort of any mixture of herbs that you
like but have parsley be most of it if
it has a really nice clean neutral
flavor that pairs really well with most
everything and then a bit of chives
because it has a really nice oniony
flavor which is great gonna add the
orange zest and then some fresh garlic
and you want to make sure that when
you're chopping the garlic you go really
fine you could even grate it on a
microplane if you like and then some
really nice D salt I like to use
something course with a little bit of
texture because then you get those nice
soft
that only adds to the finishing touches
on your shortcuts make sure that
everything is mixed together really nice
and that's it we are good to go my ribs
are in here they are done it smell
amazing and I took them out I strain the
sauce and poured it back over the ribs
and now I'm just keeping them warm
they are literally so tender that I
cannot even pick them up it doesn't
falling apart I like serving them right
out of the pot because it's nice
dramatic presentation I'm going to
sprinkle the whole pot with my grandma
Lata and then serve any extra just at
the table along side and there you have
it our red wine braised short ribs for
this recipe plus more comfort food go to
bone Appetit comm backslash comfort
you
